On Fri, 25 Oct 1996, Kristofer Ananda Carrison wrote:

> Oh my goodness...
> 
> I went to Rhythm in San Hose last night...
> and encounterd the most delicious, sexy, deep house I've ever had the
> pleasure of groovin' to.   
> 
> If ever in need of some bliss on a thursday eve-
> 

I must put my two .02 cents here..... not only was it the grooviest music
I've heard in a looooong time but it was also one of those evenings where
you get to make eye contact with everyone on the dancefloor!  People were
smiling, dancing, screaming, and having an all out incredible time.  For
such a small weekly....  I was quite taken! Dj Toby was on first and spun
some great deeeep house to get things warmed up and then Dj Daniel finished
the night off with an INCREDIBLE set of house/trance/crazy
shit-that-dances-your-body-into-another-dimension! If you are ever in the
south bay on a Thursday night or you are willing to make the trek to San
Jose...  you must catch this party!  Nice visuals, friendly vibes, great 
ventilation, and it's cheap (free before 10 and $3 after).  I know that
they are planning a Halloween party for next Thursday, anyone need a ride
from Cal-Train or from Sunnyvale/Mt View area?

Hope to see some of you south bayers there next week
(Larry, Mark, Darrell, Starchild, Brendan, you know who YOU are!)

Melissa

	and freely under the stars.

						-John Whiteside Parson

only one I've ever seen with the badge still attached.  the badge is 
metal, and has and oak leaf with a masonry bridge on top of it.  German

Let Freedom Rave...I was happy because that fact gave me another year of
ravin'...SpinSilver.....

>
>That was THE BEST party....seeing everyone pull together and put out the
>fire was soo cool.  The music had stopped during the fire and 1/2 the ppl
>were fleeing...but another 1/2 ran up the hill and put out the fire. Me? i
>was just coming on and was toooooo high to do anything...well...atleast not
>able to try and tame a fire, but i do applaude all who did.  Anyway...if
>there is one moment in my life i will NEVER forget is when all of a
>sudden.......BOOM...BOOM...BOOM the music kicked back in and just as loud
>and hard as ever...it really rocked my world. Thank u freedom!

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sat Oct 26 12:17:14 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) id MAA20586; Sat, 26 Oct 1996 12:17:14 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from ferret.slip.net by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) with SMTP id MAA20579; Sat, 26 Oct 1996 12:17:08 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from slip.net.slip.net [206.14.14.200] 
	by ferret.slip.net with esmtp (Exim 0.56 #2)
	id E0vHEE9-0002S6-00; Sat, 26 Oct 1996 12:17:01 -0700
From: "Chaz Baird" <chazb@slip.net>

Thanks for the excellent neurochemical explanation.  One word of caution,
however: if you take Prozac, DO NOT take an MAO inhibitor (most other
antidepressents are MAO inhibitors) with it...it can cause adverse
reactions like madness, death, etc.

Chaz

----------
> From: Jason Sydes <jsydes@osiris.ac.hmc.edu>
> To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
> Subject: Please Read This Ravers!
> Date: Friday, August 18, 1995 8:32 PM
> 
> Hey guys,
>        (Just one last post before I log off of sfraves for another two
> semesters.)
> 
>            This is a great post about how to stop E Neurotoxicity!
> 
>         After reading that thread about the reorginazation of neurons,
> I thought I'd put in a little bit of my knowledge and opinion. I've 
> basically spent most of my free time this summer reading the current 
> journal articles on MDMA, and I'm a junior chemist at Harvey Mudd College

> (which btw, has a pretty cool scene here...), so I THINK I am somewhat 
> reliable of a source (though I am always learning, just like everyone
else)
> 
>         If you don't like boring scientific brain stuff, just skip to the
>         end for answers on how to stop E neurotoxicity. There are
actually a
>         lot of really effective things you can do, and I've tried to list
>         all that I know of (I'm sure there are more things...).
> 
> Q: What does E do?
> A: It causes the massive release of serotonin from serotonergic
presynaptic
> neurons. Basically the neurons terminals that contain serotonin as their
> neurotransmitter are caused to fire (ie. release serotonin into the
synapse)
> by MDMA. 
> A very simplistic view of serotonin might describe it as the "happy
> neurotransmitter," since low levels of it are associated with
> depression. After this massive release your body probably cannot
recollect
> all of your serotonin (some gets degraded, some just floats away). Hence
> your serotonin levels drop.
> 
> Q: What else does E do?
> A: It inhibits TPH, tryptophan hydroxylase. This enzyme is the first of
two
> steps which transforms tryptophan (an amino acid) to serotonin. Hence new
> production of serotonin is halted (or at least slowed down
signifigantly).
> 
> Q: Is this what causes depression the next day?
> A: Most likely, yes. After a night in which a chemical has caused the
> massive release of serotonin into the synapse, and then significantly
slowed
> the new production of serotonin, your serotonin levels are likely to be
> markedly lowered.
> 
> Q: Is MDMA neurotoxic?
> A: Yes. It selectively degeneretes (note - it does NOT kill, as far as we
> know) serotonin neuron terminals. In experiments on monkeys, after
stopping
> MDMA use for approx a year, the neuron terminals were found to
> regenerate. 
> 
> MY THEORY - It's at this point that the serotonergic neuron terminals
grow 
> back to the wrong place, hence causing the abnormal connections we were
just
> reading about in the "Rave Drug May Damage Brain...." or whatever. But
this
> is just my theory on things...
> 
> Q: What causes the neurotoxicity?
> A: This one's a doozy.....  After the serotonin has binded to the
receptor
> on the other side of the synpapse (the post-synaptic neuron), there is a 
> reuptake pump (on the pre-synaptic neuron) that sucks back up the
serotonin 
> from the synapse. Every now and then the pump will suck up a dopamine
> molecule (another neurotransmitter that isn't really related to the
> "feel-good" effects of E). That dopamine doesn't have any business being
> inside of a serotonin neuron, so MAO-B degrades the dopamine, IN THE 
> PROCESS OF WHICH HYDROGEN PEROXIDE IS FORMED!!!!! 
>         
> Q: So what's the big deal about Hydrogen Peroxide?
> A: Nothing normally. H2O2 (hydrogen peroxide) is toxic to animals because
it
> splits in two to form two hydroxyl free radicals, which are very reactive
> and very damaging. Normally your body can handle these varmits just fine,
> just by reducing them with anti-oxidants (like Vitamin C, E, or
> glutathione).
> 
> Q: H2O2 and MDMA: so what's the connection?
> A: MAO-B also degrades serotonin, but not as well as it degrades
dopamine,
> but there is usually so much serotonin as compared to dopamine inside of
a
> serotonergic neuron, that it has a hard time getting around to the
dopamine,
> so very little H2O2 is formed. HOWEVER, during an E trip, a whole heck of
a
> lot of your serotonin is outside in the synapse, not in the neuron, so
the
> MAO-B has a much easier time getting to the dopamine, and hence forming
more
> H2O2. (Also I think E causes a larger production of dopamine elsewhere in
> your brain, and eventually some of that dopamine will get inside of the 
> serotonergic neurons). Now there is a much higher level of H2O2 INSIDE of
> your serotonergic neurons than your body can effectively get rid of, and
> NOW we start seeing brain damage: specifically, selective serotonergic
> neuron degeneration.
> 
> MY THEORY - The neurons form abnormal connections after being damaged,
maybe
> because they just hook up with the closet thing nearby. If you could stop
> this degeneration damage somehow, there would be no way for the neurons
to
> grow back abnormally since they are already fine.
> 
>                         END OF BORING SCIENTIFIC STUFF
> 
> Q: So how do I stop this shitty neurotoxicity?
> A: Many Many different ways. Below is a list of the ways I am currently
> familiar with, though I'm sure there are probably more...
> 
> 
> 1) Stop the reuptake of serotonin (and hence the accidental reuptake of
>    dopamine also which is the real cause of the neurotoxicity) by taking
an
>    SSRI (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor). So take:
> 
>                                 Prozac 
> 
>    Take it 3-6 hours afters taking your E dose, and this will
significantly
>    reduce neurotoxicity. THIS IS A WELL DOCUMETNED EFFECT! This is not
one
>    of my other theories. If you do this your brain will love you for it.
Any
>    other SSRI will also have the same effect (Xanax? Zoloft? Are those
SSRIs?) 
>    This might even make your trip a bit better, because it will keep the
>    serotonin in the synapse longer....
> 
> 2) Stop the breakdown of dopamine by MAO-B. This is the ultimate step
which
>    produces the toxic hydrogen peroxide. The documented case I read about
>    used:
> 
>                                L-deprenyl
> 
>    which I believe is a commonly prescribed anti-depressant, though when
I
>    think about it, maybe it's not since.... Well does anyone have any
info
>    on this or where to get it? It would be greatly appreciated....
Anyways,
>    take it the same time that you take your E, cause that's what worked
for
>    the rats.... Other MAO-B inhibitors will also work (ask your doctor
about
>    this....)
> 
> 3) Increase relative serotonin levels. If you eats lots of tryptophan at
the
>    same time you eat your E, this will overcome the inhibitory effects
that
>    E has on TPH (tryptophan hydroxylase), which will increase relative
>    serotonin levels, which will decrease the degradative actions of MAO-B
on
>    dopamine (since all of the extra serotonin will be getting in the
way),
>    which will produce less H2O2, and hence less damage. So....
> 
>         Take something like 2-3 capsules of tryptophan with 1 capsule E.
> 
>    Unfortunatley, the FDA has taken tryptophan (an amino acid!!!) off of
the
>    market for what I believe is essentially political reasons (they found
it
>    later to be a contaminent in a Japanese pharmaceuticals tryptophan
>    product that was causing the sickness, not the tryptophan itself.....)
>    You can still probably get it in Mexico though and you probably can
even
>    mail order it for European Pharmaceutical companies. It's not like
it's a
>    Schedule I drug like E is....
>    This might also make your trip a bit better because you will now be
>    continually producing serotonin. IT WILL ALMOST DEFINITELY HELP WITH
>    POST-E DEPRESSION....
> 
> 4) Stop the free-radical damage. This is the easiest to do, since
>    anti-oxidants are extremely easy to come by. Some suggestions:
> 
>         Glutathione - This a naturally occuring tripeptide in your body.
I
>                       THINK it is one of the chemicals your brain uses in
>                       the process that gets rid of free radicals. And it
>                       itself is an anti-oxidant....
> 
>         Vitamin C
>         Vitamin E
>         Melatonin (fairly good report in recent Newsweek on this)
>         Many others....
> 
>    It would probably be a good idea to take some with your E, and then
maybe
>    about 3-6 hours later....
> 
> 
> 
>                  Summary
> 
> Prozac & other SSRIs                    3-6 hours after taking E
> L-deprenyl and other MAO-B inhibitors   When you take your E
> Tryptophan ***                          When you take your E
> Anti-oxidants
>     Vitamin C
>     Vitamin E
>     glutathione ***
>     melatonin
> 
> *** - highly recommend
> 
>         Well, that's it.... Hope I haven't gone too overboard. I would
like 
> to give one last thanks to the SF scene for giving me what I believe was
the
> greatest summer I've ever had. Thanks much to all you out there who have
> make it so special....
> 
>                                           lots and lots and lots o luv,
> 
>                                                 Jason Sydes
>                                                 
> 
> 
>

Wow!

 The trance party with Goa Gil really shook my world. I probably danced 
more, felt more good energy and witnessed the unfolding of reality in far 
more profound ways then I can easily recall. Where to start?

 Major thanks to Hunab-Ku and CCC. Not only for bringing Goa Gil to us 
before he left for India, but for the _amazing_ decorations (Blacklight 
banners). It was another space removed from the world.

 We started a bit late (partially my fault) but from the first beat the 
vibe _never_ let up. 

 Goa Gil and Adam (who was likewise stunning and motivational!) were in 
the upstairs room. Downstairs the sound system was tied to the one 
upstairs. At first I thought this an unusal setup but it worked great. I 
helped with audio downstairs and brought my slides. I'll leave it to 
someone else to describe but suffice to say I was thrilled at how the 
downstairs turned out.

 At one point I was downstairs and trance dancing so hard my nipples 
started tingling. Not a little bit but A LOT! I had so much pleasure 
running through my body and the wierd thing was that my dancing was 
impressing me (more difficult than the smartalecks may think) a lot also. I 
was just so loving surfing and riding on the sound and literally being 
lifted into the air at the most perfect moments; ahh bliss. =)

 One strange thing was that it became hot and muggy on both floors, but 
rather than it bothering me I really enjoyed it. I kinda felt like a 
tadpole dancing in the water.

 Big thanks to all the very kind and wonderful people I was fortunate 
enough to talk with! Especially standing out was Erika and Liza (sp?). 
These folks shared a lot of quality time with me and I was loving every 
moment ;) Also big hug to James who really went beyond the call of duty 
to help me out =) Marrisa who helped with set up (GREAT tunnel!!) and 
clean up; you probably won't read this but thank you.

 Thank you Hunab-Ku and CCC for allowing me to work/play with you. "It 
can only get better!" =)

 Thank you Goa Gil (and ADAM!! =) for giving me my first/strongest 
exposures to trance. I feel like I've come home.


Healing love vibes to all of you,



Ran
                        (Namasate)
                             /
                       -=*=-/
                         ~

MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

possibly i have been lucky .. but i was taking Luvox, which is a similar 
drug to Prozac, for two years and never had any trouble taking e as 
well.  As a matter of fact, the first e hangover i ever had was this 
summer AFTER i had stopped taking Luvox.  Maybe there will be some 
long-term results, but i never noticed any immediate adverse effects.  
Mind you, i was taking only 50mg of Luvox a day.

I wouldn't recommend taking anything like Prozac just to have fun 
anyways.  It does NOT make you happy and perky when you first take it; 
that takes about three weeks to kick in :) the first night i began taking 
Luvox i found that i felt so unlike my usual self it was uncomfortable ..

IMHO
pounce

I don't know if this is a very good idea; some MAO inhibitors' PDR 
data say that combining them with a sympathomometic amine can cause 
a stroke.  Dying of a stroke can ruin your whole evening.

(sorry, a little long!)

Hey, I get the dubious honor of the first post on a tragedy that's enough 
to make even the happiest raver sad...

The busting of FnF!!

I sit here, totally hyped up at 2am, all glittered up and nowhere to go, 
with an SO who's falling asleep on me.  This goes beyond disappointment.

*sigh* 
My first FnF, back in April?95 at the Acme - you all remember this - got 
busted at 2am.  That night turned into a wild adventure of finding 
another party, with my extended group of _15_ ending up at several 
different places, including a superunderground and superproduced 
Dimension 7 party, and a mysterious garage behind someone's house - maybe 
some of you know it - that had been completely redone into a perfect 
chill room.  Congos, stereo, fur, trippy art... and 30 strangers in an 
e-pile.  

No such luck tonight.

Nothing else would do for me right now anyway.  I'm  hyped for a FRIENDS 
AND FAMILY party.  And, as I've been doing all day, tripping on the fact 
that there are HUNDREDS of us out there, all brimming with excitement all 
day, people getting to DropBeat _two_ hours early to camp out for tix, 
the people after the bust dancing in the parking lot, refusing to have 
their spirit vanquished.

300 tix sold out in 15 minutes, sold early because the line was so long 
there was no reason to wait til 4 (btw, when I got there!)  And I know 
hundreds more wanted to go - some newbies that members of our family felt 
should be introduced in the best way possible, many happy ravers, maybe some 
randoms.

Which leads me to question, where is the line drawn between an 
"underground" and a "massive"?  Is it simply the size, 600 versus 3000?  
Or is it the fact of commercialism versus a family party?  FnF's have 
always been small to maintain the vibe.  But there were 600 unbelievably 
excited people with tickets tonight, and I would bet another 600 who 
wanted to go, for the right reasons.

WE create Friends and Family (with all props and respect here to the 
people who actually throw it with endless hard work, energy and LOVE!) - 
but I mean WE CREATE the phenomenon that occurs with what we bring to the 
party.  Our anticipation and our participation in the party becomes a 
great group funnel of energy, creating what we desire.

So, if the miracle occurs based on the intentions of all the 
participants, does the NUMBER of participants matter?  Does a party truly 
reach a "saturation point" when you have so many people that you cannot 
get a universal vibe?  That with so many, there will be at least a few 
who will do their part to bring the vibe down? (stealing, unfriendliness, 
etc.)  If everyone who wanted tickets for tonight went, I bet you 
anything it would GO OFF as hard as always - maybe that much more amazing.

But this is all academic without spaces.  (And without $$$ for permits).  

And the ironic thing is, after all our dissing on FTT, you know all of 
them are partying their asses off right now!  Massives do have one thing 
over undergrounds: mucho money to pay off all the necessary parties.

*sigh*
Better luck next time, kids!
We WILL party
They can't stop us

Message-ID: <961027051747_1281073735@emout03.mail.aol.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: NRR : (  Re: Possible Deadly Drug Combo
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

MAO INHIBITORS: are bad news. they are an old type of anti-depressant that
have nasty cross drug synergistic problems. they work by increasing the
amount of catecholamines (dopamine, norepinephrine, and epinephrine) and
serotonin (the main neurotransmitter E works on) in the brain. because MAOIs
act on such a huge range of neurotransmitters they have a lot of side
effects. So for the most part doctors do not prescribe them at all to anyone.
One deadly drug combo is MAOI and tricyclics (another older type of
antidepressant), so that could be bad. And thus i suppose since E does
similar things that the tricyclics do MAOI and E could also be a sad
experience. BUT im not a doctor.

peace, and gosh, dont it SUCK that fnf got busted!!

well, see you all at sunset!

jeremy

Maybe one should wait to see if a party is busted or not before doing 
speed.  Otherwise, one may have nothing to do but sit at a computer all 
night, and send really long messages.

MY FIRST PARTY
The whole thread of massives vs. undergrounds reminded me that most 
people filter through the massives FIRST before reaching the 
underground.  They get a taste of something tantalizing, and search 
harder and harder for its purest form.  The massives help form the 
underground, because a person coming from massives has to work to find 
the UG, to, in a sense, "prove themselves" and what they're about.

Sometimes I think my newbies - who I introduced at the best UG parties - 
had it too easy.

Obviously, we in the UG get too arrogant, actually robbing ourselves of 
potential enjoyment because of biases against big parties.  My first 
party was a massive - and a kinda crappy one at that, Kundalini at 
Caesar's Palace - and I remember how enthralled I was all those first few 
months, going to the biggest massives every weekend.  I had a complete 
blast.  Then I moved to UG parties and found a million faults with the 
commercial parties, by comparison.  In finding what was "real" and 
"good," I lost the ability to fully enjoy something, and instead 
prejudice took its place - a value I did not think the UG would impart.

Just something I find ironic that I wanted to share.  

But maybe it's just that when everything's new, and you've just fallen in 
love, you don't notice the faults.  As the relationship continues, you 
have to learn how to live with it, beyond the honeymoon.  You see the 
entire scene with clearer vision, and become choosy about the 
characteristics that you want.

All I know is that massives are pretty much ruined for me, and I'm not 
sure how I feel about that.

I'll sum it up in two words: JOSH WINK. The man's a fucking genius,
the way he played with his turntables this morning was just brilliant.
Finishing off with Brand Nubian "Punks Jump Up to Get Beat Down" (a
hiphop classic for those who didn't know), the Prodigy's "Molotov 
Bitch" and "Poison" before the grand finale..."Higher State of 
Consciousness"! And damn did we want to hear that! =)

As far as the rest of Tribal Massive was concerned, it was just that,
MASSIVE. Starting with the line outside (about 50% longer than the
one to Ground Zero, but without the "Girls up front, guys stay in
the line"-bullshit...), massive beats, massive location (HomeBase!),
and so on.

When we got in at 11 (after adjusting our clocks for daylight savings
time), I moved straight into the house-room. And it was Clubland UK
revisited.  Heard Terrance Toy, David Harness, Wamdue Kids, Jay J, and
Marcus Wyaat spin some wonderful house. The records they spun had
everything you'd want in house, soul and beat. =) And we got to hear
Alcatraz's "Give Me Luv" twice. And my favorite house record of all
times, "Plastic Dreams" from Jaydee. 
	
Then, at 4, it was straight into the FTT room to hear and see JOSH WINK.
Like I said, the man's a genius. And DJ Sneak, who took over the wheels
after JW, was just as good. Techno at it's best. At 6:45am he was told to
turn the music off, but the house room (Organic Garden) had now progressed
into ACIDland with Barry Weaver(?) spinning some fat tunes. Especially the
one he finished off with. =)

reespect, jonas

P.S. I was the guy with the glow-in-the-dark spiral on his head. Best place
to find me? Right in front of the DJs. =)

*been a silent lurker on the list for quite awhile but i just had to 
speak up*
hallo i'm lara. nice 2 meet u *shake hand*
enough of that bullshit...
i too was at Halloween Tribal Massive... but i didn't get around to 
seeing josh wink or barry weaver or dj dan or any of them, i spent the 
whole time, dancing (bouncing?) my ass off in Planet of the Drumz to 
some phat jungle and drumnbass
	i was skeptical about going to HTM coz of the rumor that it was gonna 
get broken up, the whole "LIVE 105" deal, the fact it was at HOMEBASE 
*again*, the fact that i partied too hard the night before, etc... but 
once i made my way into Planet of the Drumz, i had died and gone to 
heaven
playing jungle like "code red - conquering lion" and then drumnbass like 
j majik's arabian nights, the room was full of diverse music, but 
everyone danced no matter what. 
	love jungle live jungle and well i met some really beautiful junglists 
there who kept me smiling the whole night through (not to say the music 
didnt do the trick but there were some serious positive vibes going on 
in that room)... didn't FEEL like a massive party to me, felt like i was 
with family... guess its all a part of the fact that *whine moan 
complain* there aren't as many jungle events as us junglists would like 
to be. 
	and might i add hardly a time when we can hear DJ SS and DJ Rap (who 
kicked SERIOUS ass)  and dieselboy (he kicked ass too) all in one night 
LIVE :> *delicious*
	who was i? uuhh well i was in front of the speakers all night, wearing 
a baggy silver shirt and even baggier pants with silver stripes down the 
legs.. o yea and you mighta seen my REALLY short bleached pigtails 
bouncing around when i was dancing.. either that or my huge grin...
	anyway thanks to everyone in that room who kept me smiling and gave me 
confidence that YES there are other junglists out there... i had a great 
night and i don't think it will be topped any time soon :>
back to your regular programming, i'm off to lurk some more...maybe...
lara
p.s. any junglists out there?? :P
p.p.s. sorry if any of you think this e-mail was wasted bandwidth, i 
just HAD to say SOMETHING about the night :> take care!

> Consciousness"! And damn did we want to hear that! =)

> As far as the rest of Tribal Massive was concerned, it was just that,
> MASSIVE. Starting with the line outside (about 50% longer than the
> one to Ground Zero, but without the "Girls up front, guys stay in
> the line"-bullshit...), massive beats, massive location (HomeBase!),
> and so on.
> 
> When we got in at 11 (after adjusting our clocks for daylight savings
> time), I moved straight into the house-room. And it was Clubland UK
> revisited.  Heard Terrance Toy, David Harness, Wamdue Kids, Jay J, and
> Marcus Wyaat spin some wonderful house. The records they spun had
> everything you'd want in house, soul and beat. =) And we got to hear
> Alcatraz's "Give Me Luv" twice. And my favorite house record of all
> times, "Plastic Dreams" from Jaydee. 
> 	
> Then, at 4, it was straight into the FTT room to hear and see JOSH WINK.
> Like I said, the man's a genius. And DJ Sneak, who took over the wheels
> after JW, was just as good. Techno at it's best. At 6:45am he was told to
> turn the music off, but the house room (Organic Garden) had now progressed
> into ACIDland with Barry Weaver(?) spinning some fat tunes. Especially the
> one he finished off with. =)
> 
> reespect, jonas
> 
> P.S. I was the guy with the glow-in-the-dark spiral on his head. Best place
> to find me? Right in front of the DJs. =)
> ***********************************************************

> *         <<<http://130.*.*.*/ask/me/about/it!>>>         *
> *    "still listening to wax, i'm not using the cd..."    *

From: simitzis@netcom.com (Steve Simitzis)

Okay, the first location was busted. And there were a lot of very
upset people... a lot of people who worked really hard to put together
such a positive, beautiful event. Some were even stifling tears as they
wrapped things up.

But instead of going home and ending the night, defeated, the words of
"...call the voicemail..." buzzed around the parking lot... So we
partied in the parking lot, waiting for an update on the voicemail
(someone had a car radio and mix tapes, so we danced on the asphalt :)

Then the word came from Patrick: "hey, anyone want to go to a party
tonight?  *the* party?" They had a space!!!! And it was in... um,
Redwood City? well, uh... okay!

I couldn't believe it! But then, maybe I could:

There was too much positive energy for this party *not* to happen. We
all wanted it to happen. Everyone wanted it to happen. And the Oakland
police weren't going to be the people to stop us.

This night is what it's all about. This party is the reason *why* I'm
a raver. Thank you so much to all of our wonderful friends and to all
of the special people on our scene. Thank you for gathering our family
together despite the circumstances.

Damn, that was the *best* party I've ever been to.

Steve

Max Vision had this to say:

>I agree it was a powerful evening!  After asking a promoter, and then a 
>few people that worked the event I came with the figure of 7500 people!

That might be a little too high a number, but HomeBase sure WAS packed.

where I spent my time. =)

>You didn't mention the incredible JUNGLE presence - which is where I spent
>most of my awe-struck time - I saw the first lady of jungle, DJ Rap who is
>as beautiful as the pounding junglist beats she was dropping for us.

of Drumz was that jungle, to me, is DEAD. But that does not make me look down
on Junglists, and it shouldn't stop anyone who feels differently about it
from enjoying what they like. =)

indeed, FnF Take 2 was truly fabulous. those of us who waited in the
parking lot felt the vibe increasing and increasing... i met more people
in that parking lot than i probably would have met all night had the party
not been busted.

by the time the new location was announced, we were all having a great
time anyway. we packed up and quickly headed into redwood city, found the
space, transformed it into a great rave space, and partied till... well, i
left at 9:30 am and the music was still going.

there was _magic_ in the air. perfect crowd. perfect vibe. i had the time
of my life. met a lot of _really_ cool people. gave and received more hugs
than ever before.

a big thank you to the FnF crew and all my "friends and family" for making
this night possible. i'll never forget it.

full of love,

brian

Hi all!

 I hope everyone had a good time wherever they ended up last night. I 
wanted to go to FnF so badly but burned out at Lunarseed and I have to 
write that paper for class on monday...

 I need to thank a few more from Lunarseed; Brian Darkness whose kindness 
really set the mood for my night, Dhiran (sp?) and Brandon (sp?) for the 
aweful job of carrying heavy stuff after the party was over, as well as 
other folks who did the same whose names escape me know.

 Onward!

 I have two partys coming up that I need help with. On Nov. 1st is Mantra 
in SF and on Nov. 16th is A Wrinkle In Time also in SF.

 Mantra:

 I need to get to SF early on Friday Nov. 1st (1 pm or so). Once I'm 
there with my equipment the driver is free to go. Will want to leave 
SF about 9 or 10 am the next day. I can swing with a different driver 
going back, however the vehicle needs to be a medium sized pickup (or 
van) or bigger, both ways. Will pay for gas and you get in free (free chai 
afterparty!!) In addition I would like to have at least one to three 
volunteer workers who likewise get in for free. You only need to commit 
to either set up OR tear down. Obviously set up will be as close to 1 pm 
Friday as possible. We should be done in plenty of time to relax, eat 
dinner and clean up before the party.


 A Wrinkle In Time:

 Arrival time, in SF, is not set yet but again should be early on 
Saturday. If possible we may set up some the Friday evening before. 
Again, I need a driver(s) for getting there and back. If neccessary we 
will pay for gas but this is a benefit for Omar and his family and every 
dollar saved goes towards them.
 I will need a bigger vehicle as I'm bringing my audio system also. Again 
the driver needs only to commit to driving as that is a lot to ask someone 
(IMHO). If there are any who would like to crew also (in addition to the 
hordes that have already volunteered) please contact me. We will be 
leaving SF sometime around 10am ish.

 Additional note; I live in Santa Cruz and give prefrence (of crew 
choice) to those who have worked with me before (for various reasons) 
and those who contact me first.

 Both events promise to be _Immense_ fun!!! =)

 On transportation; I will consider smaller vehicles if we have enough to 
get all the equipment moved (caravan style). Hatchbacks work well.

 Sorry for spamming the list with my needs and my appreciation to those 
tempted to flame me but havn't! ;)




peace y'all,



Ran @ Dionysus Dreams

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sun Oct 27 15:31:07 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) id PAA12936; Sun, 27 Oct 1996 15:31:07 -0800 (PST)
Received: from mh1.well.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) with ESMTP id PAA12893; Sun, 27 Oct 1996 15:30:59 -0800 (PST)
Received: from [199.106.63.241] (mac8100.zone.org [199.106.63.241]) by mh1.well.com (8.7.6/8.7.5) with SMTP id PAA22926; Sun, 27 Oct 1996 15:30:53 -0800 (PST)
Date: Sun, 27 Oct 1996 15:30:53 -0800 (PST)
Message-Id: <199610272330.PAA22926@mh1.well.com>
X-Sender: crunch@206.15.64.22
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
To: socal-raves@UCSD.EDU
From: crunch@well.com (John Draper)
Subject: A rave in a strange place....
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com, sd-raves@party.net
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hi....

Here's a rather strange rave report.....    Yesterday,   while at Elevator
records,  I pick up this flyer for a "Free rave" valled MDMYeah....

Lineup was "Donayan, Slinky,  Temple, Bung Ho, and more...",  so the
flyer said....

I was undecided as to whether or not to trek up into LA alone,  being
very unfamiliar with the geography and the venues,  so I decided to
stay down in San Diego and check it out.     I learned it was way out
near the US/Mexico border on this private ranch next to a state prison.

So I tried to pin-point the location with maps.yahoo.com and got totally
confused because the highways had different numbers.   Yahoo didn't have
hiway 905 East,  but I eventually found it....   and as I was heading
East on hiway 905,  seeing all these warning signs of the approaching
border,  I decided to get a little paranoid and almost started to
turn back when I found this standard station.  I pulled in and learned
that other ravers have asked for directions.

So,  was told to go out to the state prison,  and eventually found the
turn-off just 1/2 mile before the border checkpoint and sure enough,
i see this dude waving a light stick....   I pull into this dirt road
and found the party.

Not that many people were there,  as it was about 2 am when I arrived,
and perhaps about 20 - 30 people were there totally.    Music was good
Detroit house,  and the dj that followed,  mixed it up with house
and trance (and even Josh Wink's laughing track)....  It was quite
surreal,  dancing next to this big imposing state prison,  wondering
if anyone inside could hear the music.   Seeing a distinct line of lights
marking the US/Mexico border.

No police arrived,   but border patrol was everywhere....    Eventually,
things closed down about 4:30 am and I eventually made it back to the Loft.

They plan on having more parties there,  and the owner of the land is
a really cool person....  the ranch has horses and hogs,  and I stayed
for a while to bullshit with this ranch hand with what little Spanish
I know....

So,  be on the lookout for more of these parties,  but bring warm
clothes,   or plan on dancing all the time like I did to keep warm....

Although the event was promoted poorly,  I think with good promotion,
a lot more people would show up.    The DJ's were unknown but
really good.

I enjoy these smaller,  more underground parties,  then the larger
massives.     So how was YOUR weekend....  Any reports...

Crunchman

Friends and Family,

I would just like to give Phat Props to all those involved with the
organization of the party last nite!  I know that the whole crew wasn't
involved for this party, but those who did put in the time and effort for the
short time the party went on I had a blast!!!!! 

All I know, for the hour or two that I was there, I was having the time of my
life!  I mean most of the people hadn't even arrived yet, and the vibe was
still going off!  I mean people were screamin' on the dance floor, and give
phat hugz in the chill room!  I wish the Po' Po' hadn't busted the party,
which by the way was the most dangerous thing they could've done anyway, but
I won't get into that!  I hope none of you who organized the party got in any
sort of trouble! 

I also want to thank those at the Funcky Techno Tribe's Tribal Massive, who
let my friends and I into the party for free!  It was fun, although they were
a SHIT LOAD of people there!  I'm talkin' mad crazy people there!

Well I hope everyone else found something to do after the party got busted,
'cause I know a lot of people who were really stressin' at that point!  Take
care and I hope everyone has a wonderful week!

Your Friend,

Antone!

with red stripes. And thoughs silver sun glasses on my head. And I had that
skellitor look in the morning.
I sweat way to much! All the cells in my face lose water, and shrival up.

perceiving me in a bad way. I know that the way I can act sometimes, can be
perceived in a bad way. But I can't help myself. It's who I am. Atleast
when I am on E at 3:00 in the morning!

  What can i say? A phat party from the moment I got in till when we left.

band.  Well thought out and planned lightings and decorations. Solid.

lyrics, we all went through the roof. (anyone know the name of that
song?)Amazing.  Deiselboy and the other jungle djs were amazing also.

was my high-point in there.

Wink were all solid.  The trip hop room also rocked the joints in full 
effect!

unplugged in the jungle room i found out where the plugs came undone
and put them back together. =)

WOW...I am still glowing...I knew it was going to be a good day when I
woke up saturday around 1:30 pm after spending all night in the computer
lab so that I could go to FnF, when I woke up and had teh fattest smile on
my face after finding out tickets were on sale right up the street from my
house. So I put on my headphones and rode my bike up to the spot to get
there a little early. Rifing up there I feel like peewee herman in his big
adventure, grooving along to the funky beats in my headphones...the
FATTEST smile on my face, I wanted to ask someone to wipe it off because
my cheeks were hurting! There was soooo much energy happening saturday!!
	SO I get my tickets and come home glowing, and finally my roomate
si started to get buzzed off of my energy and decides that he wants to
go...did I doubt it...!So Im wondering who I should go as...Ineed a
costume, anyway, I got all excited and shaved my hair off, so my official
costume for the night was the bald guy! I guess there are a lot of us,
although I never really noticed that until last night!
	So I finally meet up with Mike and we go to the location and check
it out...the place was set up sooo rad!! major huge props to everyone that
set up the place especially the cool decorations under the parachute,
beautiful. 
	After this the party starts taking off and everything goes into
maximum overdrive until the cops show up...it seems that since FTT payed
the oakland PD 7000 bucks for security that it just wasnt fair that FnF
didnt have to pay as well, so in the interest of bearocratic fairness
we were shut down, its a good thing too, anyone could plainly see that the
FnF party was a tragedy waiting to happen...you know unruly
crowd(violently smiling and hugging eachother), dangerous weapons (hard
hitting beats and bone crushing vibe) someone might have sprained an
ankle!!!!...it was for our own good.
	so after the initial dissapointment, the general feeling was fuck
that, we are gonna go off tonight no matter what! resonance... confusion!
from the many rumors I heard people were trying to find a place that could
accomodate everyone but it just wasnt possible, and finally around 2:00
(but really around 1:00 daylight savings ya know) we were offered a space
but it was not very big...unfortunate for all the people that were waiting
for the voicemail, but there was really no other way as far as I can
see...
	MUCHO MUCHO props to the fnf crew for breaking down and setting up
so fast and perfectly! The new space was incredible!!!! once the music
started again, slip into maximum overdrive and dance dance dance!!!! I
dont think I stopped all night...it was so beautiful, such an amazing
release of energy so many good smiles and viberations on the floor. Really
quite an amazing experience for me. This was kind of my first party where
i made an effort to meet and connect with people, usually I just want to
find my groove on the dance floor and slip into it for the night and go
home refreshed. But this was different and incredible I met so many
amazing people and it was soooodifferent dancing with people that you are
connected/connecting with on the floor...so many smliles hugs ahhh im
feeling all gushy again!! many many props to the girl from seattle (lori?)
spreading soo much good feelings throughout...I wish i could say hi to
each and every sfraver that I met last night but, I just dont think that I
will remember everyone, but you are all in my heart and much to my
surprise none of you were weird freaks...well maybe a few
were...smile!!!!;-)))) 
	I do want to thank brendan 99 for introducing me to a million
sfravers and Tony rotundo for hooking me up with a much needed early
morning heineken and the whole crew that put so much effort into this
party...I hope to be able to give back some day all that I recieve from
all of you beautiful people.

tony "there is no life before early morning gabber" rose

:-)))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))

Dear Nancy & SFRavefriends,

	Excellent posts, Nancy... I was also in that garage you speak of
after Friends & Family back in April '95.  I couldn't have told you when
that was or after which party, but your description matches my memory.  I
think it may have been Noe Valley.  Memorable after-party...
	Regarding massives -- I think as the number of people increases,
the chances of having the kind of pure, joyous vibe we associate with
parties like Friends & Families decreases, but that doesn't mean it can't
happen.  It can, and it can be imho every bit as wonderful as FnF,
Harmony, et. al.
	Regarding arrogance in "the underground" -- even calling ourselves
"the underground" borders on arrogance if we're not careful how
we present ourselves.  Expecting newcomers to "prove themselves" is not,
to my mind, giving the right welcome (not that Nancy was endorsing this).

Much love,
				<<< Starchild >>>

My computer tells me that on Sun, 27 Oct 1996, Nancy Shaw shared:

> 
> Maybe one should wait to see if a party is busted or not before doing 
> speed.  Otherwise, one may have nothing to do but sit at a computer all 
> night, and send really long messages.
> 
> MY FIRST PARTY
> The whole thread of massives vs. undergrounds reminded me that most 
> people filter through the massives FIRST before reaching the 
> underground.  They get a taste of something tantalizing, and search 
> harder and harder for its purest form.  The massives help form the 
> underground, because a person coming from massives has to work to find 
> the UG, to, in a sense, "prove themselves" and what they're about.
> 
> Sometimes I think my newbies - who I introduced at the best UG parties - 
> had it too easy.
> 
> Obviously, we in the UG get too arrogant, actually robbing ourselves of 
> potential enjoyment because of biases against big parties.  My first 
> party was a massive - and a kinda crappy one at that, Kundalini at 
> Caesar's Palace - and I remember how enthralled I was all those first few 
> months, going to the biggest massives every weekend.  I had a complete 
> blast.  Then I moved to UG parties and found a million faults with the 
> commercial parties, by comparison.  In finding what was "real" and 
> "good," I lost the ability to fully enjoy something, and instead 
> prejudice took its place - a value I did not think the UG would impart.
> 
> Just something I find ironic that I wanted to share.  
> 
> But maybe it's just that when everything's new, and you've just fallen in 
> love, you don't notice the faults.  As the relationship continues, you 
> have to learn how to live with it, beyond the honeymoon.  You see the 
> entire scene with clearer vision, and become choosy about the 
> characteristics that you want.
> 
> All I know is that massives are pretty much ruined for me, and I'm not 
> sure how I feel about that.
> 
> 
>

Hi all,

You all heard the news:  FnF was busted Saturday night.  I got there
around 11:00 or so, and I danced for about five minutes before the cops
showed.  It was creepy, but amicable...the cops seemed quite pleased that
they were busting up a rave and not a fight at the infamous Flanker bar
and restaurant next door.  Grrr...

Anyway, the place was packed and loaded up in no time.  My friends and I
didn't want to leave yet...we were there to dance, but mostly we just
wanted to catch up and talk, and when we heard that the party was going to
move somewhere else...we were up for that!

Ethan called everyone to attention and asked for a show of hands to see
how many people were willing to drive to Redwood City to the backup spot.
It was unanimous, we all wanted to go.  Then Derek gave us all directions
to his shop, where he restores motorcycles.

When we got to the space, I thought:  err, this is a bit small.  But it
turned out to be the perfect size for the perfect group.

Joe Rice started us off with one of the best sets I've heard him play.
The vibe was intense..better than anything I've felt in a hundred years.

Then Ethan and Deaks played. I danced and danced.  Then I took a nap in a
cosy van outside, until the owner showed up and regretfully kicked us out
because he was leaving.  Thanks, whoever you are!

After that someone was playing some jungle-who was that?  I liked it and
danced some more.  The party was still going strong when we left - around
9 or so.  It was Derrick's birthday party!  Congratulations Derrick on
another year of life completed, and on a new one beginning.  Thank you so
much for sharing it with us!  And for throwing a party in your garage!  It
was like a dream coming true.  

Then Jason (Cinnamon Twist) and I left, after packing up the New Moon
altar.  As I left, the FnF dudes looked pretty fried, but victorious!!

Just so you know, we taped it!  This party will live on into eternity.
The dance goes on...in my car, in my house, in my Sony Walkman.

Love,

Ann

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Mon Oct 28 02:13:32 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) id CAA28373; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 02:13:32 -0800 (PST)
Received: from acergw3.acer.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) with ESMTP id CAA28368; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 02:13:28 -0800 (PST)
Received: from smtplink.acer.com ([204.160.139.137]) by acergw3.acer.com (8.7.3/8.7.3) with SMTP id CAA17594 for <sfraves@hyperreal.com>; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 02:10:40 -0800 (PST)
Received: from ccMail by smtplink.acer.com (SMTPLINK V2.11.01)
	id AA846497958; Mon, 28 Oct 96 02:03:57 pst
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 96 02:03:57 pst
From: "Andy Wyszkowski" <awyszkow@smtplink.acer.com>
Message-Id: <9609288464.AA846497958@smtplink.acer.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: I missed FNF!!! Whaa... but I did have fun! [NSFR]
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

     
     My Weekend... (Just felt like sharing)
     
     Friday Night
     
     I had already committed to going to LA, so the news of the FNF party 
     happening was ripping me apart... but I'd been invited to a Moontribe 
     event.  The party was 100% word of mouth, and the location was prime.
     
     45 minutes away from LA, at the base of a well forested valley in the 
     Angeles Crest National Forest.  The drive was mostly easy, except for 
     the oil-pan killing dirt stretch last mile.  Luckily, we were guided 
     by some very nice people and didn't hurt the car.  Me and Todd (my 
     best friend from LA) pulled in parked the car and almost froze to 
     death.  The air was about 45 degrees and dropping.
     
     11:00 PM
     Jackets and hats in tow, we walk to the site and realize... there is 
     no site.  Instead, just a couple people hanging out and enjoying their 
     surroundings in a small clearing about 80 feet by 300 feet.  A couple 
     of the crew start showing up, and we do our best to help set 
     everything up.
     
     1:30 AM
     Energy circle, some 100 people holding hands and centering as the 
     energy builds.  I look around, and right as the circle breaks up, the 
     full moon appears through the clouds.  The first DJ (I think it was 
     Brad) starts up with some Ambient going into a traditional Breakbeat 
     set to get the place moving.  Crowd is slowly growing... energy is 
     immense.. chaotic and frantic.  Swinging arms and big steps as all go 
     off to the hard trance, breaks and acid sounds.
     
     3:30 AM
     Daniel comes on.  For some the best set of the night... some inspired 
     trance and goa, although not including some of the epic build on build 
     on build psychosis I had come to expect from Daniel (or I just got 
     spoiled at F8 last weekend).  Maybe I'm just cranky.  This is peak 
     hour as far as attendance... probably about 400 people.
     
     After a while of this, I realize I am freezing my ass off, so I go 
     back to the car to crash heaterside for a couple minutes.  Needless to 
     say, I enjoy sleep way too much to stick to a couple minutes.
     
     7:15 AM
     I am woken up to the sky turning colors as the sun starts to come up.  
     I walk back to the site and Brian (I think) is spinning probably the 
     most awesome morning set I have ever heard.  A combination of House, 
     Trance, Breaks, Trip Hop, Disco, Garage, Deep House, Progressive 
     House, Electro, TV show themes, and just about everything else shy of 
     Jungle and Hardcore come blasting out of the system.  EVERYBODY is 
     dancing or sitting/dancing and its all BIG smiles.  People on 
     speakers, people coming up and people coming down... the VIBE was so 
     ridiculously good I couldn't stop dancing or taking pictures of all 
     the people there smiling.  The air starts to warm up, and the dark, 
     bundled creatures of the night before start to shed their jacket 
     layers, and it gets even more beautiful.  The clouds are blowing by 
     creating fragile natural visuals, and the wind goes anywhere from none 
     to about 25 miles per hour to keep a crazy energy reminding everybody 
     that we are here as nature's guest.
     
     Another DJ (sorry.. no name) plays a great house, deep house, disco (I 
     usually hate this stuff, but you had to be there...) set till ...
     
     11:00 AM
     Closing circle, ending in a most satisfying group hug... damn damn!  
     Trash bags get handed out and everybody goes to work cleaning up the 
     aftermath of those who can't seem to find trash cans.  A half hour 
     later and the whole place is clean.  As the main sound system's 
     generators run out of gas, over the hill I can hear a renegade sound 
     system blasting jungle... a perfect way to wrap up this party.  I 
     thank the crew for a splendid time, and go listen to the awesome 
     morning mellow drum and bass (Bukem style stuff) for a few before 
     packing up and leaving for home.  Wow.
     
     Wow.  Wow.  Wow.  Fu-u-u-u-u-uck.  I'll shut up now.  (wow)
     
     Saturday Night
     
     Heard there was a party with a Hardcore room (ew!), a Jungle room 
     (okay!), and a Trance (yeah!) room.  There were other events going, 
     but we figured this one would be cool and have something for 
     everybody.  So we call... and call.. and call.. and finally get 
     directions to:
     
     A Chinese restaurant in Norwalk (eh?)... yes, hardcore loving ravers 
     all over, with dustmasks, vacuum cleaner hoses and all.  Buffet trays 
     still left out (no food in them though :( ).  Heavy fog, strobe 
     lights, NO ROOM VIBE AT ALL, and tired, over-drugged burnouts 
     everywhere.  The only source of joy seems to be the 200 bpm twitchfest 
     at the speakers where all the hardcore tweakers are piled up.  At 
     least somebody is having fun... and they're so fun to watch!!!
     
     We hang out and hear the party will be moving... good, because I keep 
     wanting to order something as I sit at the red vinyl and brass riveted 
     booths.  So we get the new directions, an old tired warehouse in 
     downtown.  We go...
     
     Surprise!  Big line, nitrous tank outside and only one room here 
     too... luckily they're playing jungle, but it's really heavy 
     hardstep... and nobody seems to be into it.  Well, seeing as there's 
     nobody really dancing, a great big circle forms, and the people at the 
     perimeter of the circle sit down, as the oldskooolerz start to go at 
     one other.  Some pretty slick moves and great fun going back and forth 
     between those who stepped in, and it was a trippy thing to see 
     everybody watching it, rather than dancing themselves.  The venue was 
     still lame however, as there was plain bright white light everywhere.
     
     About a half an hour later, the lights turn off, and the machine gun 
     assault of gabber/hardcore begins again.  The kids in LA freak to this 
     shit, and if you haven't seen it, you should.  The speaker towers on 
     either side of the stage thing get mobbed by twitching ravers 
     thrusting their fists to the music up on the air.  As all this is 
     going on, I can't help but wonder how nice it would be to hear a 
     simple trance set.  Anything slower than 180 bpm would suit me fine 
     though.  I just hadn't had my coffee or something.
     
     Anyway, the promoters promised all the DJ's would play, so I think "in 
     not too long, the angst will die down and they'll bust out with the 
     trance DJ's".  Right about then, the music dies.  Turns out the venue 
     hasn't paid the rent in a while, or something like that.  Anyway, this 
     place gets shut down early, and the crowd seems like they're about to 
     riot, and all this crappy vibe is really starting to get on my nerves, 
     so we pack up and decide to go hit Fresh Produce, an event that looked 
     like a vibey house music party.
     
     We get to Fresh Produce, and it's going pretty good, air filled with 
     sounds of Deep House and the like, and black light and decorations and 
     costumes.  Looks like a cool place to get settled... too bad we got 
     there 20 minutes before it shut down for the night.
     
     I guess this means Denny's... ZZZZZzzzzzz......
     
     Sunday:
     Record shopping at LA's weird ass record stores.  Spent hours in the 
     bargain bin looking for old goodies.  Found some tasty white label 
     trip hop and breakbeat...
     
     All in all, probably the best and worst LA has to offer (in one 
     weekend even!).  I'm glad so many of you had a blast at FNF/FNF 
     relocated.  Wish I could have been here... sorta.
     
     :)
     
     I MISSED YOU!!!
     AndyW
     
     SoCal Promoter warning...
     
     If you are ever in LA, make it a point to miss any event by "Techno 
     Basics".  They were responsible for a fucked up party (see my Saturday 
     review), more than half the DJ's falling through, not delivering shit 
     they promised, bullshit decor (read none), overpriced water, gun 
     packing security that totally harassed some guy for smoking a hand 
     rolled cigarette but let people do nitrous the whole time we were in 
     line, having ravers driving around town at 3:00 while totally fucked 
     up, and after all that, throwing stuff at the audience and just being 
     shitty when people started cheering "refund".  Plus they lie, and they 
     suck and they didn't seem like very nice people.  So there.  I just 
     wanted to hear some trance and jungle like they advertised... is that 
     so wrong?  I'd be happy to discuss this with anybody... but the facts 
     are pretty clear.
     
     Brief record review...
     
     Has anybody heard Nearly God (the new Tricky)?  It's really rough 
     sounding but... overall... dark, funky, too stoney, too amazing.

"Let me have silence always in the centre of the shouting, that is
essential. Let me have silence so that no pin may drop and not be
heard, and not a whisper. Escape us for all our spouting, nor the
needle scratching upon this gramophone of the circular cosmic spot.
Hear me, mark me, learn me, throw the mind's ear open. Shut up the
mind's eye, all will be music. What sculpture of sound cannot, what
cannot as a fluid token words, that nothing else cannot." 

						-Wyndham Lewis

the intensity i witness at these parties is like nothing else. the 
dedication, the pure desire to make it happen, and our collective energy 
exploding in finally overcoming the difficulties we encountered.

the cops came, shut us down, and that was just teh beginning...
what happened from then on was simply magical. from about 7oo people who 
wanted to party, downsized to about 2oo or less of those who refused to 
give up, who were dedicated to be together to celebrate... came together 
in that small redwood city space. everyone there wanted to be there with 
intense desire, and that first beat driven thru those tiny speakers moved 
the universe... ->pure divine energy<-
and 15 minutes later the big stacks came on...
		->earth shaking bass<-
and memories were born...

->resonance<-
	tom

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----

Another in a long series of really, really intense weekends.  Yikes.
To sum it up:

Space Children: had to leave before they even got set up :(
FnF: got there just as it got busted
FnF II: drool, drool!!  :)
Sunset: beautiful, too bad I was so tired (no sleep for the wicked ;)

  Sleep deprivation can be really fun!!
  I have to say that for me, the best part of FnF was the incredible
charged-up energy of the crowd during the move... when the music first
went back on, and everyone just completely lost it for a whole hour, there
were many dozens of spntaneous group hugs & everyone was screaming,
yelling, bouncing, and the feeling was so incredible!!!  I felt (for the
first time) really comfortable in the packed part of the dance floor... a
mental adjustment - being part of the single organism made up by the
entire crowd, rather than an individual among a mass of other individuals.
Beautiful!
  Deaks capped off my night perfectly with that one hardcore track - very
intense & the perfect way to drive myself into the ground for sleep.
Which was not meant to be, in the end - I just had to stay up and have
wonderful rambling conversations until (and during, and after) sunset.  I
love that warm fuzzy glow everything gets around it when you're totally
exhausted!
  Sunset - danced only a tiny bit, mostly just laid around, hugged,
talked, and napped.  And stared across the bay in disbelief - I *live*
here!!!  I love this part of the world, love the city, love the people &
the feeling & everything, everything about the way my life is going right
now.  I love my adopted family, the SF ravers.  You rule!!
  I love this game!!!!!

:     the open and has other people looking at it."                  :

 with ESMTP (Apple Internet Mail Server 1.1.1); Mon, 28 Oct 1996 11:00:18 -0700
Message-Id: <v03007803ae98eb3e1043@[207.76.139.151]>
Mime-Version: 1.0

To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
From: Ethan Miller <ethan@bass-station.com>
Subject: Friends & Family
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 1996 11:00:18 -0700
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Greetings Friends

I just wanted to personally offer my sincerest apologies for FnF getting
busted.

Needless to say we couldn't do FnFs for $5 if we purchased the $8000+
permits the cops wanted to us have. Not having them was why they busted us.

In the end I think that all "underground" parties come down to a coin toss
as to whether they'll get busted or not. Over the 2.5 years that we've been
doing FnFs this is only the second bust, so I guess we've won that toss
much more often than not.

I also wanted to apologise for our voicemails being confusing in the
aftermath of the bust. While still at the space we called a variety of
other spaces that might have been able to accomodate the bulk of the party,
none of which were available. Finally we headed towrds what was described
as a very small warehouse in Redwood City. It turned out to be very small
and was packed with the 50 or so people that followed us there. Given that
there was no more room in the space at that point, one voicemail was
changed, saying it hadn't worked out. The other voicemail broke  such that
I couldn't change it, so it still said call back in an hour etc. I think
the vm that was working was changed again once the sun was up as many
people had left and there was a bit more room, but I'm not sure. In any
event, at this point we were just trying to make the best of it for as many
people as we could.

Obviously I feel very bad that many of you payed for a party that got
busted very early. While this is onbviously no justification, let me just
say this....

The reason FnFs have never been more than $5 is that everyone involved
works for free, donating their time, energy, and enthusiasm to the effort,
often at a cost to themsleves, especially considering the substantial
amounts of money people have invested in their lighting equipment their
sound equipment, etc.  Even with with all of the above donated, parties
stil cost lots to throw...there is the space, insurance, water, additional
sound and and lighting etc. and hence whoever undertakes throwing these
parties takes on a fair amount of risk.  I'm happy to say and I hope you
are too, that while the party didn't happen the other night, no one person
took a big financial loss, and more importantly no one was charged with a
crime or arrested. So in this sense I think this community -- many of you
that is to say -- took the risk and bore the cost and of trying to thow
this party, thankfully at a very low cost per person. I hope you feel your
contribution was well placed. We do hope to throw a make-up party sometime
though we're not sure when yet, so hang on to your tickets. Also, the folks
at MAD have graciously offered to let anyone with an FnF ticket in free
tonite, so head down to MAD tonite, it's always rocking =)

Many thanks for the continued support, sorry this one didn't work out.

ethan


( ethan miller )-------------- ----------
( http://www.bass-station.com )---------- -----------------------------------

To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
From: Dan Capriles <c9d@ix.netcom.com>
Subject: Fnf vs. FTT..went to both
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Well....I went to my first friends and family party last sat. and WOW.  From
the second i walked in i could feel the energy.  This party seemed perfect,
especially since I planned on partying sober.  Everyone was friendly and
excited to be there and the music rocked.  So, about 45 min. into being
there it gets busted, which leaves me with a big problem.  I was with my
x-girlfriend and she kept hassling me to go to FTT, cuz "all our friends are
there". (what she really meant was all HER friends were there.)

So, after some delliberation, we go.  YUCK!

That was one of the lamest parties i've ever been to, especially coming from
the killer vibe at FnF.  I have never been in such a cold space and around
so many cold people before.  There was like 100,000 watts pumpin in the main
room...actually the sound system was pretty nice.  And like 3 other rooms, 2
jungle/trip hop and 1 house.  I was having no fun..so i decided to take my
vitamin E.

Good e, but it only helped a little.  The music was so..so.  Josh wink and
dj rap had the best sets. IMHO. Dj rap is amazing and she had 2 live
MC's...pretty slick. oh yeah, she's a complete hottie too. ;)

The ppl. were mixed and i got bumped into, not politely i might add, several
times.  Got a couple not so friendly looks, my friends got hassled and 2
other ones had to jump out of the way of 5 guys bum rushing into a fight.
Witnessed several ppl. getting drunk out of their mind, which IMHO
alcohol+the wrong ppl. = trouble....well atleast not a positive vibe.

I did meet some cool ppl, but i hope so since there were like some 6,000 ppl
there.

I guess the point to my story is that i'm really sad that Fnf got busted.
By going to FTT i really realized how much some massives can indeed suck,
but i guess they made 100's of thousands...so SOMEBODY had fun. ;0

I hope u all had a good weekend and i hope sunset went off! i didn't get to
go cuz i was moving all day sunday.

Much plur,
Micron

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Mon Oct 28 11:00:06 1996
Received: by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) id LAA12885; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 11:00:06 -0800 (PST)
Received: from twaxx.twaxx.com by taz.hyperreal.com (8.7.6/V2.0) with SMTP id KAA12798; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 10:59:54 -0800 (PST)

	 id KAA12243; Mon, 28 Oct 1996 10:46:49 -0800
From: "-=jack=-" <jack@twaxx.twaxx.com>
Message-Id: <9610281046.ZM12241@twaxx.twaxx.com>
Date: Mon, 28 Oct 1996 10:46:37 -0800
In-Reply-To: Dan Capriles <c9d@ix.netcom.com>
        "Fnf vs. FTT..went to both" (Oct 28, 10:32am)
References: <1.5.4.32.19961028183242.0068333c@ix.netcom.com>

To: sfraves@hyperreal.com, Dan Capriles <c9d@ix.netcom.com>
Subject: Re: Fnf vs. FTT..went to both
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

That was one of the lamest parties i've ever been to, especially coming from
the killer vibe at FnF.  I have never been in such a cold space and around
so many cold people before.  There was like 100,000 watts pumpin in the main
room...actually the sound system was pretty nice.  And like 3 other rooms, 2
jungle/trip hop and 1 house.  I was having no fun..so i decided to take my
vitamin E.
-----------------------
Well, it must have something to do with the eye of the beholder.  My
take was that friends and family couldn't have touched the massive I
attended at funky techno.  As for cold people, I have to say, that unless
your part of the "friends and family clique", friends and family events
can often be pretty cold also.  In fact, I have had much better times at
massives and have been welcomed with open arms by 17 year olds from
Hayward, etc., while at a friends and family event, I couldn't even get
an E to save my fucking life.  I guess if you're part of the sfraves
gang, and schmooze with people, then perhaps it's more fun, and people are
more friendly, but the only people who have really been very welcoming to
me at friends and family events are the people I already know.  On the other
hand, like I said, I've been treated more warmly by youngsters I don't even
know at bigger parties, and not just this Saturday, although this Saturday
was a serious case in point.  I don't want to schmooze you people, I go to
parties to dance, have fun, and go nuts.  I'm a 60 hour week hacker and I
don't have time to go out often, and when I do, I don't want to have to run
around meeting all the "right people" before I can get connected, have fun,
have people to talk to, etc.  I've felt this way for a long time now, and
have never said anything before about this, as I really don't want to be a
downer, but when I saw this note, I simply had to respond.  I have also had
other people tell me they feel similarly, but whatever the case, your mileage
may vary.  It is my feeling, however, that these parties, while small and
intimate, often aren't very friendly unless you know a significant number of
people at the event.  Last Saturday at this giant warehouse in Oakland with
some 4000 kids, I was treated like family by more kids than I can even
remember.  Yes, it was crowded.  I like that anyway.  Yes, there were people
there who don't know the scene, but everybody has to have a first time at
any sort of thing, and raving is no different.  I also would like to mention
that with even thousands of kids, from all over the place, I personally
didn't witness even the slightest trouble with aggressive males (the folks
you all call "hunters and gatherers"... that's pretty elitist, folks), or
anything even remotely like that, although I can't say it didn't happen, as
the place was much to large to see everything happening...

That brings me to another point.  The parties you folks throw tend to have
a rather homogeneous crowd, which isn't a bad thing per se, but the fact is,
it's much more difficult to get a friendly happy environment when you have
people there from radically different homes, races, socioeconomic backgrounds,
and the like.  Most brilliant of all was that funky techno tribe was attended
by a *very* diverse crowd, a much more diverse crowd than you folks have ever
attracted, and the vibe was still incredibly friendly, peaceful, and as
Coolio says... "all the way live"....  I'm not saying that you should go out
and try to attract a more diverse crowd, there is a place for both massives,
and the parties you throw in this scene here in the bay area, but when I hear
people capping like that, I'm likely to speak.   I don't want to rain on your
parade, but I've been to alot of parties, and that massive was fucking rocking,
in a most delightful way, so I felt your analysis needed a little
counterpoint....

Finally, I must agree with Dan that alcohol is often a serious problem, and
especially when the numbers are large (i.e. the crowd), and I'm usually not
into being around alcohol drinkers (I rarely drink myself), but in this
little formula "which IMHO alcohol+the wrong ppl. = trouble", I have to
note that "the wrong people" is a pretty subjective term.  I didn't notice
hardly any of "the wrong people" at this party, out of the many thousands
who were there.  I don't want to be one of the precious few, I am simply a
person who likes to dance and have fun with my fellow humans... wherever
they are from.  Oh yeah, Dan was right, the sound system was kickin' and
the beats were pretty damn fat!


-=jack=-

"That's cause I'm slick, tossin bottles like a discus,
 the liks can rock a party from Halloween to Christmas
 That's why I'm screaming at MC's like I'm Onyx,
 I'm hooked on gin & tonics like your mama's hooked on phonics"
